title: Nicer error messages for linting migrations
body:
When linting migrations, I found the output incredibly difficult to parse. It's difficult to even find the failing predicate, and if you've added a lot of migrations, it's difficult to find the one that failed.

~I've changed the migration linter a bit. Essentially, while you can use ordinary predicates and specs, you can also define a spec using `or-error-conformer`. It's used like this:~

```
(s/def ::my-spec
 (or-error-conformer
  (fn [value]
   (when (invalid-value? value)
    (error "Error message" :arbitrary "data" :goes "here")))))
```

~~In the failure case here, we aren't saying the item is invalid - we're just conforming it to a special `::errors` spec.~~

~~Then, when we check the validity of the migrations, we use `s/conform`. Then, we check to see whether the resulting conformed value has any errors, and if there were, print them nicely before exiting with an error code.~~

~~Of course, we also check whether the result of `s/conform` was `::s/invalid`, and the output is the same as before in that case.~~

**Edit: I decided not to do the approach described above.**  Instead...

In general, just throw exceptions instead of using clojure spec here.

You'll only get one error per run, but that seems fine.

I did keep some specs around, but run them slightly differently. Rather
than validating the whole collection of changeSets at once with `s/+`,
just `doseq` through the changeSets and validate each one separately.

That way, the value that's presented as erroneous is much smaller (a
single changeSet) and it's easier to see what went wrong.

The result: when you run `./bin/lint-migrations-file.sh`, you get output like

```
jds@arc metabase % ./bin/lint-migrations-file.sh
Clearing outdated .cpcache directories if needed...
.cpcache directories are up to date.
Check Liquibase migrations file...

Error:	Change set IDs are not distinct.
Details:

 {:duplicates ("v49.2024-05-20T20:37:55")}
```

rather than the previous huge blob of EDN.
author: johnswanson
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

So it helpfully prints out the entire collection. #### this PR ``` ‚ùØ bin/lint-migrations-file.sh Clearing outdated .cpcache directories if needed... .cpcache directories are up to date. Check Liquibase migrations file... Error: Change set IDs are not in order Details: {:out-of-order-ids (("v51.2024-05-13T16:00:00" "v51.2024-05-13T15:30:57"))} ``` I think this out of order sequencing is a large part of the pain point after rebasing/merging master. I checked one other common occurrence: forgetting to put a `comment` on a changeset and there is no difference. It is 222 lines of output that are difficult to decipher but not impossible. Finally I removed the `remarks` on a column (another common thing to forget) and got 695 lines of output, again the same on master and this branch. Overall a fantastic improvement on the out of order case. No worse on the remarks and comments omission. But what an improvement!', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 6, 5, 21, 7, 6, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

dpsutton on (2024-06-05 21:07:06 UTC): I swapped the last two migrations so that they are no longer in order. #### master It's 14k lines of output. ``` ‚ùØ bin/lint-migrations-file.sh | wc 14544 34096 810707 ``` It is moderately helpful: ``` Validation failed: [{:path [:databaseChangeLog], :pred lint-migrations-file/change-set-ids-in-order?, :via [:lint-migrations-file/migrations :lint-migrations-file/databaseChangeLog], :in [:databaseChangeLog]}] ``` But the predicate "change-set-ids-in-order" failed, but to it, the _collection_ lacks this property, rather than two individual out-of-order rows. So it helpfully prints out the entire collection. #### this PR ``` ‚ùØ bin/lint-migrations-file.sh Clearing outdated .cpcache directories if needed... .cpcache directories are up to date. Check Liquibase migrations file... Error: Change set IDs are not in order Details: {:out-of-order-ids (("v51.2024-05-13T16:00:00" "v51.2024-05-13T15:30:57"))} ``` I think this out of order sequencing is a large part of the pain point after rebasing/merging master. I checked one other common occurrence: forgetting to put a `comment` on a changeset and there is no difference. It is 222 lines of output that are difficult to decipher but not impossible. Finally I removed the `remarks` on a column (another common thing to forget) and got 695 lines of output, again the same on master and this branch. Overall a fantastic improvement on the out of order case. No worse on the remarks and comments omission. But what an improvement!

title: Fix OSS tests in CI
body:
### Description

It appears that a handful of OSS-only tests were not running properly in CI. Something about the `describeOSS()` wrapper was making some (but not all!) of these OSS tests never run. Removing the describeOSS block and using `onlyOSS` in the beforeEach hook gives us the intended behavior.

Since these hadn't been run in a while, they needed to be rewritten to reflect changes in the app

Before üò¢  | After üéâ 
---|---
![Screen Shot 2024-06-05 at 12 50 58 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/472a6830-5a6e-427b-9a6b-7c87300620e2) | ![Screen Shot 2024-06-05 at 12 50 09 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/3bdc0983-dc7b-4a74-bf03-80d64964b94d)

title: 43475 command palette icon tweaks
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43475

### Description
Small change to how Icons defined for search results and recent items. We now use the `getIcon` function to determine the name and the color of the icon. If no color is returned, we default to brand.

### How to verify

1. Open the command palette and observe icon colors. Icons should be brand color by default, but official collections (and verified models?) should be yellow
2. Searching should yield consistent icon colors

### Demo
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1328979/74caf8c4-5dbf-42f1-87e7-ef5f8e33f653)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: npfitz
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

- Create a Row chart
- Hover any row
- Ensure it does not shrink

title: Run smaller smoke test suite for pre-release check
body:
### Description

- This tags a small number of "smoke" tests to ensure that jars are working as expected before release
- This also parallelizes certain tasks in the pre-release job to make it complete faster

This should reduce the time it takes to release by about 15 minutes.

> [!Note]
> This needs to be backported because we test release jars off of their own commit - so it's the test tags that really need to be backported

title: Put New Tests in Flake Jail + Parole Well Behaved Tests
body:
### Description

After a meeting of the flaky test parole board, we decided to let several tests out of the flaky test job for good behavior. This made room for a new batch of newly-flaky tests to pay their debts to society in the flaky test job. We'll review their records in the near future to see if they deserve to re-join the general testing public.


see: [replay io dashboard](https://app.replay.io/team/dzoyNTM4ZjRmOC05YmFlLTRiYjYtYjljYi1jOGYzOWUyMjRhZWY=/tests) and [stats](https://stats.metabase.com/question/18032-10-flakiest-tests) for the most wanted list

title: fix percent change e2e flakes and failures
body:
### Description

Two types of tests were flaking in this file for different reasons, possibly due to differences in behavior post-React 18 upgrade. Note that I'm backporting this PR to the 50 release branch because I have another backport that is blocked by these flaky tests.

1. Bar series

Unlike line series, we need to pass the `index = 1` parameter when calling `showTooltipForBarInSeries` to hover the datum and show its tooltip. 

The underlying selectors are different, `path[d="${CIRCLE_PATH}"][stroke="${color}"]` for line series, and `path[fill="${color}"]` for bars, so maybe that's the root cause of the difference, but for now manually providing the index of 1 instead of 0 for bars suffices to fix the flakes.

2. Daylight savings related tests

Some of these would hover over 4 datum in a series, and for some reason the tooltip selector method would flake frequently when trying to select the fourth. I've fixed the flakiness by modifying the questions and selecting only 3 datum instead. This works consistently locally, and hopefully in CI as well.

Additionally, to help reduce flakiness we now hover the settings menu after each datum. For some reason hovering multiple datums consecutively causes the tooltips to flake.

### How to verify

Run tests locally and in CI multiple times

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: EmmadUsmani
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('flaky-test-fix', ''), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: feat(sdk): customize dashboard, dashcard and question background color
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42678 ### Description Exposes the following theme colors to the user for customizing their static dashboard and static question colors. - `background-dashboard`: background color of dashboards, default to `background` (`bg-white`) - `background-dashboard-card`: background color of dashboard cards, default to `background` (`bg-white`) - `background-question`: background color of questions, default to unset. ### How to verify - Go to the `test-dashcard-background` branch in the demo app - Go to `http://localhost:3004/dev`, you should see a static dashboard and some static questions in the Kitchen Sink. - Change the above colors in `theme.colors`, and the color should change accordingly. ### Demo Setting `colors.text-*` and `colors.background` results in a transparent-ish theme. Adding `theme.components.dashboard.card.backgroundColor` adds background to the card. Adding `theme.components.question.backgroundColor` sets the question background color, and `theme.components.dashboard.backgroundColor` sets the background color to the dashboard component. ### Caveats - There is no stories/visual tests and unit tests that renders static dashboard yet, so I wasn't able to write tests for this. @oisincoveney any recommendations on rendering the static dashboard in a Storybook environment?
author: heypoom
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: Add CI job for Databricks JDBC
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43497

This PR (1) does cleanup (todos, better implementation of `describe-database`) and (2) adjusts the driver so test datasets can be loaded.

For reviewer: Please see just the test extensions. I'm asking for a review of that mostly at this stage. At the moment I'm trying to achieve something similar as implemented in Athena. Just loading data in at the moment. Loading works, but I'd like to get feedback on the overall approach -- ie. having Databricks instance with pre loaded databases.

Sidenote: It may later turn out it is not necessary, maybe it would be possible to create "namespace" per run, load and delete afterwards as other drivers do.
author: lbrdnk

title: loki CI improvements
body:
### Description

This PR optimizes `.github/workflows/loki.yml` by skipping it when a targeting PR has no relevant changes.
Loki tests will be triggered when:
- Frontend sources changes (not specs)
- Frontend/Backend CI workflows are updated
- Storybook configuration changes
- `./loki` directory that contain snapshots changes

title: Fix "Manage database" perms incorrectly show up on the schema-level permissions page
body:
Closes #37998

### Description

Fixes "Manage database" column from incorrectly appearing at the schema-level view of the group permissions editor.

This was a result of a miscalculation of the current permission level being edited. We were calculating
- db level -> "schemas" (correct)
- schema level -> "schemas" (incorrect - should be "tables")
- table level -> "tables" (incorrect - should be "fields")

This resulted in the schema-level view being interpreted as the db-level view when deciding which columns to render. This PR updates the code to use the same logic used to decide which permissions graphs to generate, as the logic needed to do this differs between the database permissions editor and the group permissions editor (which also accounts for why this bug did not appear in the database permissions editor).

### How to verify

- Have a database with multiple schemas
- Go to admin settings -> permissions
- From the group permissions view, select your database w/ multiple schemas
- Validate that the "Manage database" is no longer there
author: sloansparger
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: feat(sdk): SDK theming part 3 - brand, brand-light, brand-lighter
body:
Relates to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42694
Also is a small part of https://www.notion.so/metabase/100-Align-approach-to-Mantine-styles-customization-1066f77c43694c36a6e90a3d2374b731

### Description

Migrate hardcoded colors used in emotion styles:

- brand `${color("brand")}` -> `var(--mb-color-brand)`
- brand-light `${color("brand-light")}` -> `var(--mb-color-brand-light)`
- brand-lighter `${color("brand-lighter")}` -> `var(--mb-color-brand-lighter)`

### How to verify

1. CI should pass
2. Visual tests should return same results
author: deniskaber
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: Merge combine column components
body:
### Description

This clean up PR merges the different implementations of the combine columns shortcut popover that exist in the codebase.

### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. Browse data -> Sample Dataset -> Accounts
2. Click the "First Name" header
3. Select "Combine columns"
4. Play around with the settings and make sure everything works as expected

title: Fix flaky `interactive-embedding.cy.spec.js`
body:
Fixes #43587 

Fix flaky test in `e2e/test/scenarios/embedding/interactive-embedding.cy.spec.js`. Reported by @npfitz 

This started to flak very recently. Please see the flake results [on stats](https://stats.metabase.com/question#-IGVtYmVkZGluZyA-)


### Results
- [PR stress tests](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9370117815/job/25796260816)
- [Master stress tests](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9368577269) <- This one always fails on `master` on the last assertion if it's not failing on the flake assertion because the last assertion assume the viewport is 800px tall, but the config on master doesn't specify the height value so it uses the default 660px instead.
author: WiNloSt

title: remove modified padding on ellipsifyed sidebar items
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42877

### Description
Removes overwritten padding on sidebar items that have tooltips, making them consistent with other items in the list

### How to verify

1. Add 2 items to your bookmark list, one with a short name, and one with a long enough name to be ellipsisified (over 35 characters).
2. Hover over each and examine their heights

### Demo
![chrome_22zPgq7lZa](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1328979/3510b678-67ae-4189-922e-2c161ffe8eb5)

title: Update dead jetty docs links
body:
Example of a failed `markdown-link-check` job: [link](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9363184012/job/25773407863?pr=43220)

Related Slack thread: [link](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C5XHN8GLW/p1717488857104699)

### Description

Looks like Jetty v9 docs are no longer available, see https://jetty.org/docs/index.html

Dead links:
1. https://www.eclipse.org/jetty/documentation/jetty-9/index.html#configuring-ssl ([archive.org](https://web.archive.org/web/20190330174612/http://www.eclipse.org/jetty/documentation/current/configuring-ssl.html))
2. https://www.eclipse.org/jetty/documentation/current/#configuring-connectors ([archive.org](https://web.archive.org/web/20190330174758/http://www.eclipse.org/jetty/documentation/current/configuring-connectors.html))

New links:
1. https://jetty.org/docs/jetty/12/operations-guide/keystore/index.html
2. https://jetty.org/docs/jetty/12/operations-guide/protocols/index.html

We'll need to backport this as far as v48.

### How to verify

New links make sense.
CI is green.

title: compute viz settings for static pie chart
body:
### Description

Computes viz settings for the static pie chart. For now they are just logged to the console, in a later PR they will be used to render the chart. 

### Demo

![Screenshot 2024-06-03 at 2.37.55 PM.png](https://graphite-user-uploaded-assets-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/9ULpbAzGBtvQRyZEpGvu/38aae26e-9903-49be-b716-f448a4204211.png)

These are the defaults for the chart (nothing has been manually changed).

title: Fix new collection modal auto-focus moving
body:
Fixes #41241

### Description

This PR solves a bug where the name input on the create collection modal was getting validated on mount (see related issue for repo).

The issue was due to this logic in the Mantine Modal component:
> If you do not add data-autofocus attribute and do not use FocusTrap.InitialFocus, modal will focus the first focusable element inside it which is usually the close button.
> \- [mantine docs](https://mantine.dev/core/modal/)

Since `autoFocus` was set on the name input. it was getting focused first. Then mantine was moving focus to the close button, thus causing the name input to be `touched`. This triggers Formik to validate the form which results in the error appearing without the user interacting with the form.

The fix is to not use `autoFocus` but instead use `data-autofocus`

### Demo

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/7104357/12798683-9d9d-40b8-9feb-a358107aec3e
author: sloansparger

title: Release from tagged test jars
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43504

### Description

Currently, when we release a new metabase version, we build a fresh jar from a given commit and tag it with the correct release version upon starting the build.  This is unnecessary since we already build and test a separate jar for every commit on the release branch. All we really need to do is modify the `version.properies` file in the test jar, to "tag" it with a defined version number. This allows us to cut ~8 minutes off our build time when we release, and also have greater confidence in the actual artifact we are releasing.

This PR does a few things to enable this workflow:
1. We hook the test build job into the get-build-requirements script to ensure that any jar built off a release branch is built with the correct nodejs and java version (so we can be sure they are releasable)
2. Adds a new`tag-for-release.yml` workflow that pulls in a test jar, and modifies only its `version.properties`, computes a new checksum, and uploads that artifact as the release artifact.
3. Adds a fallback mechanism where, if the tag-for-release workflow cannot find a cached release jar (because the release commit is too old or too new) it falls back to using the existing build-for-release job.

![Screen Shot 2024-06-03 at 4 09 47 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/08cb5529-593c-447b-aaa4-4a2e67f51da7)

![Screen Shot 2024-06-03 at 5 10 08 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/1bbfffae-bdcc-46b1-a147-e8afa05ec477)


### How to verify

These release jobs are never fully testable except in a real release, but I've tested a couple scenarios in my fork:
‚úÖ  release build exists for commit: [tag succeeds](https://github.com/iethree/metabase/actions/runs/9357505009) and triggers tests
‚úÖ  release build does not exist for commit: [fails](https://github.com/iethree/metabase/actions/runs/9357752800) and[ falls back to build-for-release](https://github.com/iethree/metabase/actions/runs/9357757295) and triggers tests
‚úÖ  should [not break e2e workflows on PRs](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/9357939752?pr=43545) or release branches
author: iethree

title: [WIP] ‚Äî Fix broken line/area/bar charts after adding a second stage filter
body:
Closes #10493

Fixes an issue when adding an n-th query stage would drop `graph.dimensions` and `graph.metrics` viz settings (by default selected by [`getSingleSeriesDimensionsAndMetrics` function](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/8659846f0b011af29f92719ac9273c63df76e0d3/frontend/src/metabase/visualizations/lib/utils.js#L283)) and put a chart into unexpected state.

This happens in some cases after adding a new query stage. When a new stage is added, some column metadata becomes opaque (e.g., which columns come from aggregations or breakouts). In certain cases, there are no columns to auto-pick instead, and the chart "breaks" (it's still possible to select x/y axis columns manually; it's just annoying).

The fix is implemented on the QB level. Each time a query is completed, we calculate the default `graph.dimensions` and `default.metrics`, and if they appear empty, we will try to use the previous value instead. If the last value is actually irrelevant (e.g., a column is no longer there), the viz settings layer should invalidate and recalculate them again.

I've considered making a fix closer to the viz settings layer, but we'd need to make viz settings aware of their previous value if we do something similar. Another idea is to port `graph.dimensions` and `graph.metrics` calculation to MBQL lib, but that'd require passing `metadata` down to the viz layer which we're not really doing AFAIK. Would appreciate feedback on the solution üôè 

### To verify

1. New > Question > Orders > Visualize
2. Click the "Quantity" column header and select "Distribution"
3. Add a filter on the "Count" column
4. Ensure the x and y axis didn't change

### Demo

**Before**

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/17258145/772115f7-54c7-4631-85d6-1d9554ec0dd4

**After**

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/17258145/ee679f8b-b321-4dfb-9017-f34f88ef0328
